physDesc.p: This letter is two pages long. It is typed on Amy Lowell’s stationary, with the heading “Miss A. Lowell, Heath Street, Brookline, Mass.” The words “Poetry (Harriet)” are written in pencil at the top of the page

div.p: Let me thank you very much for this cheque of $100.00, and for your two notes, all of which came this morning. I am afraid you will think me a great pig not to return this cheque as you suggest, but the truth is that I like to keep my earnings and my donations separate, and also I am a little stuck this month, myself, and have unfortunately arranged to spend your cheque, knowing it was coming, before I received it.

I am truly sorry if this embarrasses you in any way, and I shall be very glad to send you $100.00, half of what I promised, on the first of May, the balance to be paid, as agreed, on the first of August.

I am sending Ezra a small sum as a wedding present, so that will help along, if you want to send him anything before receiving my cheque on the first of May. I will send it to you on the very first day, so that that won’t,
I hope,put you out very much.

I see from this cheque that you have paid me for "A Tale of Starvation," as well as the other poems, for which I am most delighted and grateful, and I hope that this means that you will truly publish it.

Of course you remember that in sending these poems, I stipulated that they should come out before October, as I wish to incorporate them in my book which is to be published on the first of October. The October number will be all right, if you cannot get them in before.

As far as the copyright notices are concerned, we are to have the copyright notices, including yours, on the reverse of the title, and the acknowledgments under the table of contents. I hope that this will satisfy you.
Do you want me to review Grace Fallow Norton’s new book for you? Don’t bother to send it, if you do. I have it, and can send you a review quite easily for the May number.
I hope that my delaying three weeks in sending you the money will not make a great difference to you, as it does really make considerable difference to me at the moment.
